newsitem.title: VIETNAM: Vietnam wins aid for integration into WTO.
newsitem.headline: Vietnam wins aid for integration into WTO.

text.p: The United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) and the Swiss government have agreed to fund a two-year project aimed at helping Vietnam prepare for membership of the World Trade Organisation (WTO).
The UNDP said on Wednesday the $1.27 million project, to which Switzerland has contributed $400,000, would help the communist country improve trade negotiation and trade policy formulation.
Vietnam initiated the formal process for entry into the WTO in early 1995, soon after the organisation's establishment.

The Hanoi government says membership would open access to international markets and, as a consequence, support its economic reform process and create a favourable environment for domestic and foreign investors.

"... accession to the World Trade Organisation will further widen Vietnam's open-door policy, further reduce isolation and strengthen the country's links with the rest of the world," U.N. Resident Coordinator Roy Morey said in a statement.
